intro: Zeylanidium olivaceum, commonly known as the olive tree, is a species of flowering plant in the family Oleaceae. It is native to the Mediterranean region and parts of Asia, characterized by its evergreen leaves and fragrant flowers. The plant is known for its ability to produce olives, which are used in food and oil production. Zeylanidium olivaceum thrives in well-drained soil and requires a temperate climate with adequate sunlight. Its botanical features make it an important agricultural and ornamental plant.
